info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 11:36PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Laurens, southwestern Chester, Spartanburg, western Cherokee and Union Counties through 1215 AM EDT... At 1136 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles north of Spartanburg to 9 miles northwest of Union to 21 miles west of Chester. Movement was southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spartanburg, Union, Boiling Springs SC, Woodruff, Pacolet, Cowpens, Inman, Monarch Mill, Mayo and Roebuck. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
